subsections.title: Graph Coloring / Bipartite / Cycle Detection
subsections.info: This section explores problems based on graph coloring and bipartiteness. A graph is bipartite if its nodes can be colored using two colors such that no two adjacent nodes share the same color. This is equivalent to checking whether the graph contains an odd-length cycle. These concepts are used in cycle detection, scheduling, grouping problems, and more.
